<DOMAIN>HR</DOMAIN>
<RESUME_START>
HR ASSOCIATE
Professional Summary
Enthusiastic and goal-oriented HR Professional with 3+ years experience driving innovation and strategy for a global
technology organization. Excellent reputation for proactively resolving problems, communicating effectively, and
driving overall operational improvements. Relocating to the San Francisco Bay Area and seeking a fulltime role
in Human Resources or Talent Acquisition where I can leverage my experience and provide value to the company.

SKILLS

Recruiting Onboarding Project Management Event Planning Employee Relations Teamwork/Collaboration Training and Development Public Speaking Social Media Marketing ADP Workday Microsoft Office Suite ADP Benefits Branding Budget Oral communication Competitive Email
Employee Relations Event Planning Focus Hiring HRIS HR Leadership Marketing MS Excel Microsoft Office Suite Product manager Project Management Public Speaking Recruiting Recruitment Researching Strategy Teamwork Workshops Written
Work History
HR Associate ,

07/2018 to 12/2019
Company Name
— City , State
Conducted full lifecycle university recruitment (sourcing, screening, selecting, hiring, and onboarding)
Learned multiple HRIS systems and recruiting platforms including Workday, Taleo and Handshake
Led company internship program and facilitated training for interns across different functions and locations
Served as student liaison for company hackathon and grew participation from 20 to 100+ attendees
Proactively communicated with business partners, hiring managers, and external candidates to quickly
resolve issues and ensure overall positive recruitment experience
Gained proficiency in variety of other HR tasks to include strong understanding of compensation and benefits,
training and development, employee relations, and regulatory compliance.
HR Intern ,

09/2016 to 12/2017
Company Name
— City , State
Co-developed university recruitment strategy for Raleigh-based hires by researching
universities and local events, attending career fairs, executing social media strategy to support branding,
serving as the campus liaison for the annual company hackathon and actively tracking a funnel of 500+
intern applicants to assist in candidate selection process
Learning & Development: Partnered with VP Talent Development to create and present leadership
sustainment webinar for Zenger Folkman 360 feedback participants
Workforce Planning: Used MS Excel to create enhanced data structure during the product manager career
framework deployment
Employee Relations: Implemented, tested, and conducted surveys for a newly introduced scavenger hunt
app as part of the employee onboarding 2.0 development plan.
Orientation Leader ,

06/2016 to 08/2016
Company Name
— City , State
Served as first-hand liaison for 250+ students to facilitate smooth transition to NC State University
Facilitated parent panels, conducted student small groups and led guided tours for incoming first years
Trained in diversity and inclusion workshops to foster inclusive and welcoming community for all students
Enhanced written and oral communication skills throughdaily public speaking and email communication.
CurrentUniversity Programs Lead ,
12/2019
Company Name
— City , State
Develop university recruitment strategy for LexisNexis North America to proactively build talent pipeline for
key skillsets and increase brand awareness in target markets
Played key role in launching the company's first program for new graduate FTE hires
Expanded company intern program from less than 10 to 50+ interns
Communicate with internal stakeholders to determine people strategy and campus hiring targets per
function/location
Develop relationships with key university partners to build campus brand and position the company as an
employer of choice
Create targeted outreach and engagement strategies for schools that offer competitive talent, focus on D&I,
and align with business priorities
Attend on-campus and virtual career fairs, events, and hack-a-thons
Manage budget for all university recruitment related expenses
Measure and evaluate ROI each cycle to determine go-forward investment.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Human Resources Business Partner

Location: Sugar Land, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Human Resources, Training

Description:
SUMMARY
AMS HR Business Partner will be responsible for ensuring, for the AMS Region (North America) effective execution of all HR processes with particular focus on talent management that includes communication and people development, as well as the organizational alignment to business needs, in strict coordination with the General Manager, Global HR Director of the division and Corporate HR.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
• Participate as required in the development of the HR and Division business plans and programs, particularly from the perspective of the impact on people. Translate them into HR operational plans in application of the guidance and inputs received by HR Corporate,• Define the yearly HR budget and plan in coordination with Corporate HR, Regional Hub General Manager and the Global HR Director,• Ensure the effective use and maintenance of the proper tools (SuccessFactors, etc.),• Manage, in strict coordination with Corporate HR, Regional Hub General Manager and the Global HR Director continuous people management and development including competence/performance assessment, training, succession planning, internal job rotation, international mobility, etc., • Be the point of reference for all workers, employees and company management for identifying and managing all people development path• Advice executives and managers in the most effective communication and interaction with people,• Manage the organizational structure and role grading and description in coherence with the approved budget and the company and people needs, applying the guidelines provided by HR Corporate,• Manage internal communication and events boosting a positive internal climate, developing consistent actions plan in response to company surveys to boost it as required,• Liaise and lobby with schools, colleges/universities and professional communities to identify and boost partnerships and mutual opportunities. Pursue the best practices and programs to attract, select and recruit “talents”.
QUALIFICATIONS 
At least 3 years related experience in HR management within multinational companiesPreviously held leadership rolesKnowledge/experience in: Local labor disciplines Managing HR economicsAble to travel 10-20% of time to other De Nora facilities as required.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCEBachelors or Masters degree in Human Resources; Bachelors in Business Administration or equivalent
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONSNone
PHYSICAL DEMANDSReasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
